bwapi

Enum Text

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Text>
      • bwapi.Text
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Text>

    public enum Text
extends Enum<Text>
    Enum containing text formatting codes.

    Such codes are used in calls to Game.drawText(bwapi.CoordinateType, int, int, java.lang.String, bwapi.Text...), Game.printf(java.lang.String, bwapi.Text...)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Text.Size
      Enumeration of available text sizes.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      Align_Center

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • Previous

        public static final Text Previous
        Uses the previous color that was specified before the current one.

      • Default

        public static final Text Default
        Uses the default blueish color. This color is used in standard game messages.

      • Yellow

        public static final Text Yellow
        A solid yellow. This yellow is used in notifications and is also the default color when printing text to Broodwar.

      • White

        public static final Text White
        A bright white. This is used for timers.

      • Grey

        public static final Text Grey
        A dark grey. This color code will override all color formatting that follows.

      • Red

        public static final Text Red
        A deep red. This color code is used for error messages.

      • Green

        public static final Text Green
        A solid green. This color is used for sent messages and resource counters.

      • BrightRed

        public static final Text BrightRed
        A type of red. This color is used to color the name of the red player.

      • Invisible

        public static final Text Invisible
        This code hides all text and formatting that follows.

      • Blue

        public static final Text Blue
        A deep blue. This color is used to color the name of the blue player.

      • Teal

        public static final Text Teal
        A teal color. This color is used to color the name of the teal player.

      • Purple

        public static final Text Purple
        A deep purple. This color is used to color the name of the purple player.

      • Orange

        public static final Text Orange
        A solid orange. This color is used to color the name of the orange player.

      • Align_Right

        public static final Text Align_Right
        An alignment directive that aligns the text to the right side of the screen.

      • Align_Center

        public static final Text Align_Center
        An alignment directive that aligns the text to the center of the screen.

      • Invisible2

        public static final Text Invisible2
        This code hides all text and formatting that follows.

      • Brown

        public static final Text Brown
        A dark brown. This color is used to color the name of the brown player.

      • PlayerWhite

        public static final Text PlayerWhite
        A dirty white. This color is used to color the name of the white player.

      • PlayerYellow

        public static final Text PlayerYellow
        A deep yellow. This color is used to color the name of the yellow player.

      • DarkGreen

        public static final Text DarkGreen
        A dark green. This color is used to color the name of the green player.

      • LightYellow

        public static final Text LightYellow
        A bright yellow.

      • Cyan

        public static final Text Cyan
        A cyan color. Similar to Default.

      • Tan

        public static final Text Tan
        A tan color.

      • GreyBlue

        public static final Text GreyBlue
        A dark blueish color.

      • GreyGreen

        public static final Text GreyGreen
        A type of Green.

      • GreyCyan

        public static final Text GreyCyan
        A different type of Cyan.

      • Turquoise

        public static final Text Turquoise
        A bright blue color.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static Text[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (Text c : Text.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static Text valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null
